Class Match

java.lang.Object
  Match

public class Match
extends Object

The Match class is the main ``controller'' of the yahtzee match. A Match sequence is as follows: each player gets to play their turn in the first round, then each player gets to play their turn in the second round, and so on until all MAXROUNDS (13) rounds have been played for the first game. Then each player gets to play the first round for the second game, and so on... The Match class controls the following:

  • which Player plays next, and which is the current Player;
  • the round number (0 through MAXROUNDS-1);
  • the game number (0 through MAXGAMES-1).

Field Detail

MAXGAMES

public static final int MAXGAMES
The maximum number of games per match. This value must be 5 when the class is submitted.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAXPLAYERS

public static final int MAXPLAYERS
The maximum number of players allowed per match. This value must be 5 when the class is submitted.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAXROUNDS

public static final int MAXROUNDS
The maximum number of rounds per game. This value must be 13 when the class is submitted.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Match

public Match()
Constructor for the match. Initialises the number of players, the game number, the round number, and the current player number all to zero.

Method Detail

addPlayer

public void addPlayer(String name)
Instance method which adds a named player into the set of players and adds one to the total number of players.

getCurrentPlayer

public Player getCurrentPlayer()
Instance method which returns the Player who's turn it is.

getGameNum

public int getGameNum()
Instance method which returns the number of the current game. The number returned is 0 or greater (zero for the first game). Note that the graphical user interface is responsible for quitting the game when the game number advances to MAXGAMES

getNumPlayers

public int getNumPlayers()
Instance method which returns the number of players. The number returned is in the range 0 to MAXPLAYERS. Returns zero only when no players have yet been added through addPlayer().

getPlayer

public Player getPlayer(int playerNum)
Instance method which returns the specified Player.

Parameters:
playerNum - numerical identifier for the player. Must be in the range 0 to n-1, where n is the number of players in the game.

getRoundNum

public int getRoundNum()
Instance method which returns the number of the current round. The number returned is in the range 0 to MAXROUNDS-1.

nextPlayer

public void nextPlayer()
Instance method which advances to the next Player. If this is the last Player then advance to the next round. If this is the last round, then advance to the next game.
